general_advisory: Due to the formation of a low-pressure system, rainfall activity is likely to occur. Make bunds to store rainwater and complete paddy transplanting process. Spray insecticides and pesticides in the early morning or evening hours.

advisory: Keep a standing water level of 2-3 cm during transplanting and make bunds for storing rainwater.
Transplant 2-3 seedlings together with proper spacing.
Take measures to manage Blast diseases and stem rot.
Watch for fall army worm infestation and apply pesticides correctly.
Remove weeds, maintain drainage, and be vigilant against aphid and thrips infestations.
Watch for sucking pests, grasshoppers, and bugs. Apply Imidachloprid to manage aphids.
Control Yellow vein mosaic virus with proper spraying techniques.
Apply profenophos + cypermethrin for controlling caterpillars.
Make drainage channels to remove excess water and manage wilting with appropriate sprays.
Keep the field weed-free for healthy growth.
Monitor for diseases and pests, apply suitable pesticides to control thrips and leaf blight.
Apply Mancozeb or Thiram to manage Fusarium wilt and spray Copper oxychloride for cercospora leaf spot.
Prevent water stagnation and fungal diseases with proper care and sprays.
Control Papaya mosaic virus transmission through effective pest management.
Create rings around plants for water storage and eliminate extra suckers for better growth.
Provide clean drinking water and maintain cleanliness in the cattle shed.
Prepare Jeevamrut for natural fertilization in the field.
